sites.name: Museo del Prado
sites.description: The Prado Museum is Spain's premier art gallery and one of the world's most important museums. Housed in a neoclassical building designed by Juan de Villanueva in 1785, it contains one of the world's finest collections of European art from the 12th to early 20th century. The museum's collection includes masterpieces by Spanish artists such as Velázquez, Goya, and El Greco, as well as works by Flemish, Italian, and German masters. The building itself is a work of art, with its grand entrance hall and elegant galleries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Free entry 6-8 PM Monday-Saturday and 5-7 PM Sundays. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours and increased visitors. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended to avoid queues. Audio guides available in multiple languages. Guided tours offer deeper insights and require advance booking. Photography not permitted in permanent collection galleries. Museum café offers pleasant courtyard seating. Combined tickets with other museums available.

sites.name: Palacio Real
sites.description: The Royal Palace of Madrid is the official residence of the Spanish royal family, though it is now only used for state ceremonies. Built between 1738 and 1755, it is the largest functioning royal palace in Europe. The palace features over 3,000 rooms, including the stunning Throne Room, Hall of Mirrors, and Royal Chapel. The building combines Baroque and Classical architectural styles, with lavish interiors decorated with works by artists such as Goya, Velázquez, and Caravaggio.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Summer brings longer hours and increased visitors. Changing of the Guard ceremony occurs weekly. Special state ceremonies may affect access. Winter offers fewer crowds but shorter hours. Spring and autumn provide ideal visiting conditions.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended to avoid queues. Guided tours available in multiple languages. Photography permitted in most areas. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Audio guides provide detailed historical context. Combined tickets with other royal sites available. Free entry for EU citizens on certain days.

sites.name: Parque del Retiro
sites.description: El Retiro Park is Madrid's most famous park and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Originally created as a royal garden in the 17th century, it was opened to the public in 1868. The park features beautiful gardens, fountains, sculptures, and the iconic Crystal Palace. The artificial lake, where visitors can rent rowboats, is a popular attraction. The park also houses several museums and exhibition spaces, making it both a recreational and cultural destination.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round from sunrise to sunset. Spring brings blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures. Summer offers outdoor activities and evening entertainment. Autumn features beautiful fall colors. Winter provides clear views and fewer crowds. Special events and performances throughout the year. Rowboat rentals available in warmer months.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Rowboat rentals available on-site. Multiple entrances provide convenient access. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Park maps available at information points. Street performers and artists common in good weather. Café kiosks provide refreshments throughout the day.

sites.name: Plaza Mayor
sites.description: Plaza Mayor is Madrid's grand central square, built during the Habsburg period. This rectangular plaza, surrounded by three-story residential buildings with 237 balconies facing the square, has been the site of various public events since its construction in 1619. The square features the Casa de la Panadería (Bakery House) with its distinctive painted facade, and the equestrian statue of Philip III. Today, it serves as a popular gathering place with numerous restaurants and cafés.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring outdoor dining and street performers. Christmas market transforms the square in December. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures for outdoor enjoyment. Winter brings holiday decorations and seasonal events. Street artists and performers frequent the square in good weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Restaurant terraces operate first-come basis. Tourist information center located nearby. Historical plaques explain the square's evolution. Multiple transportation connections available. Street performers frequently present, especially weekends and evenings.

sites.name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía
sites.description: The Reina Sofía Museum is Spain's national museum of 20th-century art. Housed in a former hospital building with modern extensions, it is best known for housing Picasso's masterpiece 'Guernica'. The collection focuses on Spanish artists including Dalí, Miró, and Juan Gris, as well as international contemporary artists. The museum's architecture combines historic and modern elements, with the glass elevators by Jean Nouvel being particularly notable.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Free entry 7-9 PM Monday-Saturday and 1:30-7 PM Sundays. Less crowded on weekday afternoons. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended to avoid queues. Audio guides available in multiple languages. Guided tours offer deeper insights and require advance booking. Photography permitted in most areas. Museum café offers pleasant seating. Combined tickets with other museums available.

sites.name: Puerta del Sol
sites.description: Puerta del Sol is one of Madrid's most famous and busiest squares. Historically the site of one of the city's gates, it is now a major public space and transportation hub. The square features the iconic clock tower of the Casa de Correos (Post Office), the statue of the Bear and Strawberry Tree (symbol of Madrid), and the Kilometer Zero plaque marking the center of Spain's road network. It is a popular gathering place and the site of New Year's celebrations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. New Year's Eve brings massive crowds for the grape-eating tradition. Summer evenings particularly lively with street performers. Christmas season features special lighting and decorations. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter brings holiday festivities. Street artists and performers frequent the square in good weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Multiple transportation connections available. Tourist information center located nearby. Historical plaques explain the square's significance. Street performers frequently present, especially weekends and evenings. Major shopping areas easily accessible.

sites.name: Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza
sites.description: The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum houses one of the world's most important private art collections, spanning from the 13th to the 20th century. The collection was acquired by the Spanish state in 1993 and is displayed in the Villahermosa Palace. The museum features works by major artists including Van Gogh, Monet, Degas, and Picasso, offering a comprehensive overview of Western art history. The building itself combines historic architecture with modern exhibition spaces.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours. Free entry on Mondays 12-4 PM. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended to avoid queues. Audio guides available in multiple languages. Guided tours offer deeper insights and require advance booking. Photography permitted in most areas. Museum café offers pleasant seating. Combined tickets with other museums available.

sites.name: Gran Via
sites.description: Gran Via is Madrid's most famous street, known for its early 20th-century architecture and vibrant atmosphere. Built between 1910 and 1929, it features numerous Art Deco and Neo-Baroque buildings, including the iconic Metropolis Building and the Telefónica Building. The street is lined with shops, theaters, restaurants, and hotels, making it a major commercial and entertainment hub. The architecture reflects Madrid's early 20th-century modernization.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring outdoor dining and street performers. Christmas season features elaborate light displays. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter brings holiday decorations. Street artists and performers frequent the area in good weather. Theater season runs September-June.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Theater tickets available at box offices or online. Multiple transportation connections available. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Street performers frequently present, especially weekends and evenings. Major shopping areas easily accessible.

sites.name: Templo de Debod
sites.description: The Temple of Debod is an ancient Egyptian temple that was dismantled and rebuilt in Madrid's Parque de la Montaña. Dating from the 2nd century BCE, it was gifted to Spain by Egypt in 1968 in gratitude for Spanish help in saving other temples from flooding during the construction of the Aswan Dam. The temple is one of the few Egyptian temples outside Egypt and offers a unique opportunity to see ancient Egyptian architecture in Europe.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Sunset views particularly spectacular. Summer brings longer hours and increased visitors. Winter offers clearer views but shorter hours. Spring and autumn provide ideal visiting conditions. The temple's location in a park makes it pleasant to visit in good weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Free entry. Photography permitted. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Historical plaques explain the temple's significance. Located in a park, can be combined with other nearby attractions.

sites.name: Mercado de San Miguel
sites.description: The San Miguel Market is a historic covered market near Plaza Mayor, featuring a beautiful iron and glass structure from 1916. Renovated in 2009, it has become a popular gourmet food market offering high-quality tapas, fresh seafood, and Spanish specialties. The market combines traditional market atmosphere with modern culinary trends, making it a favorite destination for both locals and tourists seeking authentic Spanish food experiences.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Evening hours particularly lively. Summer brings outdoor seating and extended hours. Winter offers cozy indoor atmosphere. Spring and autumn provide pleasant visiting conditions. Special events and tastings throughout the year. Holiday season brings special offerings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Popular times may require patience. Multiple vendors offer different specialties. Standing room only at most counters. Cash and cards accepted. Located near Plaza Mayor for convenient sightseeing. Guided food tours available.

sites.name: Santiago Bernabéu Stadium
sites.description: The Santiago Bernabéu Stadium is home to Real Madrid and one of the most iconic football venues in the world. It hosts thrilling matches, offers an extensive museum, and provides guided tours that celebrate the club's rich history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Tours available year-round with some restrictions on match days. Peak visiting times coincide with the football season, while off-season tours offer a quieter experience.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking is recommended for stadium tours. Guided tours are available, and photography is allowed only in designated areas. Check the match schedule before visiting.

sites.name: El Rastro
sites.description: El Rastro is Madrid's most famous open-air flea market, offering a diverse range of antiques, clothing, and unique souvenirs. Held every Sunday and public holiday, the bustling market reflects the city's vibrant culture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open on Sundays and public holidays. Mornings tend to be less crowded, while late mornings can be busy. Weather conditions can affect the overall experience.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Comfortable walking shoes are recommended, and visitors should be mindful of their belongings. Bargaining is a common practice.

sites.name: Real Jardín Botánico
sites.description: The Royal Botanical Garden offers a peaceful retreat in the heart of Madrid. Home to an extensive collection of plants from around the world, it provides a serene setting for leisurely strolls and educational experiences.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, although some sections may be closed for maintenance in winter. Spring and summer showcase vibrant blooms, making it ideal for picnics and quiet reflection.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided tours are available and photography is permitted. Check the schedule for seasonal events and special exhibitions.

sites.name: CaixaForum Madrid
sites.description: CaixaForum Madrid is a dynamic cultural center housed in a former power station. It features contemporary art exhibitions, workshops, and educational programs in a striking architectural space.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with rotating exhibitions. Crowds may increase during major events and weekend programs, with special discounts often available for students and seniors.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking for special exhibitions is recommended. Check the official website for current events and program schedules. Photography policies may vary by exhibition.

sites.name: Teatro Real
sites.description: Teatro Real is Madrid's premier opera house, renowned for its impressive architecture and world-class performances. It hosts operas, ballets, and concerts, offering a rich cultural experience in the performing arts.
sites.seasonal_notes: The performance schedule varies seasonally, with peak times during opera festivals and holiday seasons. Evening performances are most popular, so booking well in advance is advised.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets should be booked online early. Check for any discount offers and be aware of the dress code. Guided tours of the theater are also available on non-performance days.

sites.name: Círculo de Bellas Artes
sites.description: The Círculo de Bellas Artes is a cultural institution offering exhibitions, film screenings, and workshops. Its rooftop provides stunning panoramic views of Madrid and hosts various events and performances.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with a busy schedule of events. Evening rooftop exhibitions and programs are particularly popular, especially during the cooler months.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets are required for events and rooftop access. Online booking is recommended, and visitors should check event schedules for any special exhibitions or performances.

sites.name: Museo Arqueológico Nacional
sites.description: The National Archaeological Museum of Spain houses an extensive collection of artifacts spanning from prehistoric times to the early modern period. It offers deep insights into Spain's rich historical and cultural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Peak visiting times are typically weekends and school holidays, with special temporary exhibitions rotating seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets are recommended to avoid queues. Audio guides are available and photography is permitted in designated areas. Guided tours can enhance the visit for groups.

sites.name: Casa de Campo
sites.description: Casa de Campo is Madrid's largest public park, offering expansive green spaces, a lake, and a variety of outdoor recreational activities. It is a popular spot for picnics, cycling, and boating, providing an escape from the city's hustle and bustle.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer weekends can be crowded, while mornings and weekdays are quieter. Autumn and spring offer pleasant weather ideal for outdoor activities.
sites.booking_tips: No booking is required for general access. On-site bike rentals and boat rides are available, making it a great choice for family outings and group activities.

sites.name: Matadero Madrid
sites.description: Matadero Madrid is a contemporary arts center housed in a former slaughterhouse. It hosts a range of exhibitions, performances, and cultural events, offering a unique blend of industrial architecture and creative expression.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with varying schedules for exhibitions and events. Crowds may increase during major cultural festivals and special installations.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking is recommended for special events. Visitors should check the official schedule and note that photography policies may vary by exhibition.

sites.name: Puerta de Alcalá
sites.description: Puerta de Alcalá is a grand neoclassical gateway and one of Madrid's most iconic landmarks. Erected in the 18th century, it once served as one of the city's main gates and now stands as a symbol of Madrid's rich architectural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Evening illumination enhances its beauty, making it a popular spot for photography and leisurely strolls, especially in spring and autumn.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Easily accessible by public transportation and located near several cafés for refreshments.

activities.name: Semana Santa (Holy Week)
activities.description: Experience Madrid's solemn and spectacular Holy Week processions, featuring ornate religious floats, traditional music, and dramatic religious imagery through the historic streets.
activities.seasonal_notes: Dates vary each year (March-April) with processions throughout Holy Week, particularly impressive on Holy Thursday and Good Friday. Madrid's processions are known for their solemnity and historical significance.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early to secure viewing spots along the official routes. Plaza Mayor and Calle Mayor offer good vantage points. Book accommodation months in advance as this is peak visitor season.

activities.name: Madrid Open Tennis Tournament
activities.description: Watch world-class tennis at the Mutua Madrid Open, featuring top players competing on clay courts in the Caja Mágica complex.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held annually in May, this prestigious ATP and WTA tournament brings the world's best players to Madrid.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online through the tournament website as soon as they go on sale. Weekend matches and finals sell out quickly.

activities.name: Retiro Park Spring Gardens
activities.description: Explore the beautiful spring blooms in Madrid's most famous park, featuring the Crystal Palace, rose gardens, and seasonal flower displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring (April-May) brings spectacular blooms, particularly in the rose garden and around the Crystal Palace. The park's trees and flowers create a stunning display.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early to avoid crowds. Weekday mornings offer the most peaceful experience.

activities.name: Madrid Book Fair (Feria del Libro)
activities.description: Browse thousands of books and meet authors at this annual literary festival in Retiro Park, featuring book signings, readings, and cultural activities.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in late May/early June, this event transforms Retiro Park into a literary paradise with hundreds of book stalls and cultural activities.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for popular author signings. Many events are free but some may require advance registration.

activities.name: Madrid Marathon
activities.description: Participate in or watch Madrid's annual marathon, which takes runners through the city's most iconic landmarks and streets.
activities.price_range: Free to watch, Moderate to participate
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in late April/early May, offering ideal running conditions with mild temperatures and clear skies.
activities.booking_tips: Register months in advance if participating. Spectators can watch from various points along the route; Plaza de Cibeles offers a great vantage point.

activities.name: Real Madrid vs Barcelona (El Clásico)
activities.description: Experience one of world football's greatest rivalries at Santiago Bernabéu Stadium when Real Madrid hosts Barcelona.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring matches often have significant implications for the league title, creating an electric atmosphere.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets sell out quickly; purchase through official channels as soon as they become available. Consider hospitality packages for guaranteed seats.

activities.name: Madrid Cocktail Week
activities.description: Sample creative cocktails from Madrid's best bars during this week-long celebration of mixology.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in May, featuring special cocktail menus and events at participating bars throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase a wristband for access to special events and discounted cocktails. Some events require advance booking.

activities.name: Madrid Design Festival
activities.description: Experience exhibitions, installations, and events celebrating design in all its forms across various venues in Madrid.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring edition focuses on contemporary design with exhibitions, workshops, and talks throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival website for program details. Some events require advance registration.

activities.name: Spring Art Week
activities.description: Visit galleries and art spaces participating in this city-wide celebration of contemporary art.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in May, featuring special exhibitions and events at galleries throughout Madrid.
activities.booking_tips: Download the official map of participating venues. Many galleries offer extended hours during the festival.

activities.name: San Isidro Festival
activities.description: Experience Madrid's traditional festival honoring its patron saint, featuring bullfights, concerts, and traditional celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in mid-May, marking the beginning of summer with traditional celebrations and cultural events throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Bullfight tickets should be purchased in advance. Many street events are free but arrive early for good spots.

activities.name: Madrid Pride (Orgullo)
activities.description: Join one of Europe's largest LGBTQ+ celebrations featuring parades, concerts, and cultural events throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in early July, transforming the city with rainbow colors and celebrations in Chueca and beyond.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation months in advance. Many events are free but some parties require tickets.

activities.name: Veranos de la Villa
activities.description: Enjoy open-air concerts, theater performances, and cultural events in various venues across Madrid.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer-long festival offering cultural entertainment in outdoor venues throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online when the program is announced. Popular events sell out quickly.

activities.name: Madrid Río Summer Activities
activities.description: Enjoy the Manzanares River park with swimming pools, outdoor activities, and cultural events along the river.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings various activities and events to this riverside park, including outdoor cinema and concerts.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for most activities. Arrive early for popular events and swimming pools.

activities.name: Madrid Foodie Week
activities.description: Sample special menus and culinary events at participating restaurants throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer edition features special menus and culinary events showcasing Madrid's dining scene.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance at participating restaurants. Special menus often require advance booking.

activities.name: Madrid Jazz Festival
activities.description: Experience jazz performances in various venues across the city, from intimate clubs to outdoor stages.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings jazz performances to various venues, including outdoor concerts in parks.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for specific performances. Some venues offer season passes.

activities.name: Madrid's Rooftop Bars
activities.description: Enjoy drinks and views at Madrid's rooftop bars, which come alive during summer evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings offer perfect conditions for rooftop dining and drinking with spectacular city views.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance, especially for sunset views. Popular spots include The Hat, Círculo de Bellas Artes, and Hotel Riu.

activities.name: Madrid's Summer Sales
activities.description: Take advantage of summer sales at major shopping areas including Gran Vía, Calle Serrano, and various malls.
activities.seasonal_notes: Major sales begin in July with significant discounts at stores throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds. Many stores offer online shopping with in-store pickup.

activities.name: Madrid's Summer Cinema
activities.description: Watch movies under the stars at various outdoor cinema venues throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings outdoor cinema screenings to various locations, including parks and cultural centers.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Bring blankets or chairs for comfortable viewing.

activities.name: Madrid International Film Festival
activities.description: Experience one of Spain's most important film festivals, featuring premieres, retrospectives, and special events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in October, showcasing international and Spanish cinema with red carpet events and screenings.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online when the program is announced. Popular screenings sell out quickly.

activities.name: Madrid Wine Week
activities.description: Sample wines from across Spain at various events and tastings throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings wine-focused events and tastings, celebrating Spain's wine culture.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets for specific tastings in advance. Many events require advance registration.

activities.name: Madrid Fashion Week
activities.description: Experience Spain's premier fashion event, featuring runway shows and industry events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn edition showcases upcoming spring/summer collections with various events and shows.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets are primarily for industry professionals, but some events are open to the public with advance booking.

activities.name: Madrid's Autumn Parks
activities.description: Enjoy the autumn colors in Madrid's parks, particularly Retiro and Casa de Campo.
activities.seasonal_notes: October-November brings beautiful autumn colors to Madrid's parks and gardens.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit on weekdays for fewer crowds. Early morning offers the best light for photography.

activities.name: Madrid's Autumn Gastronomy
activities.description: Sample seasonal dishes and participate in food events celebrating autumn ingredients.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal specialties including mushrooms, game, and traditional stews.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables at participating restaurants. Many offer special autumn tasting menus.

activities.name: Madrid's Autumn Art Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit major art exhibitions at Madrid's museums and galleries during the autumn season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings major exhibitions to Madrid's museums, including the Prado, Thyssen, and Reina Sofía.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many museums offer combined tickets for multiple exhibitions.

activities.name: Madrid's Autumn Theater Season
activities.description: Attend performances at Madrid's theaters as the new season begins.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn marks the beginning of the theater season with new productions and performances.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many theaters offer season subscriptions.

activities.name: Madrid's Autumn Markets
activities.description: Browse seasonal products at various markets throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal products and special markets featuring local produce and crafts.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for the best selection. Many markets offer guided tours.

activities.name: Madrid's Autumn Music Scene
activities.description: Enjoy concerts and performances at various venues throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings various music events and performances to Madrid's concert halls and venues.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many venues offer season subscriptions.

activities.name: Christmas Lights on Gran Vía
activities.description: Experience Madrid's spectacular Christmas light displays along Gran Vía and other major streets.
activities.seasonal_notes: Displayed from late November through early January, with synchronized light shows and festive decorations.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; shows typically run from 6pm to midnight. Most crowded on weekends and holidays.

activities.name: Three Kings Parade (Cabalgata de Reyes)
activities.description: Witness the traditional Three Kings parade through Madrid's streets on January 5th.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held on January 5th, featuring elaborate floats and candy distribution to children.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for good viewing spots along the route. Bring bags for collecting candy.

activities.name: Madrid's Christmas Markets
activities.description: Browse traditional Christmas markets throughout the city, particularly in Plaza Mayor.
activities.seasonal_notes: Open from late November through December, featuring traditional crafts and holiday items.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays to avoid crowds. Plaza Mayor's market is the most traditional.

activities.name: Madrid's Winter Museums
activities.description: Explore Madrid's world-class museums during the quieter winter season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers fewer crowds and special exhibitions at Madrid's major museums.
activities.booking_tips: Many museums offer free entry on certain days. Check schedules for special winter hours.

activities.name: Madrid's Winter Gastronomy
activities.description: Sample traditional winter dishes and seasonal specialties at restaurants throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings traditional dishes like cocido madrileño and seasonal specialties.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance, especially for traditional restaurants. Many offer special winter menus.

activities.name: Madrid's Winter Theater
activities.description: Attend performances at Madrid's theaters during the winter season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings various performances and productions to Madrid's theaters.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many theaters offer winter season subscriptions.

activities.name: Madrid's Winter Parks
activities.description: Enjoy Madrid's parks during the quieter winter season, particularly Retiro and Casa de Campo.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers peaceful walks and unique perspectives of Madrid's parks.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit on sunny days for the best experience.

activities.name: Madrid's Winter Shopping
activities.description: Take advantage of winter sales and shopping opportunities throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: January brings major sales with significant discounts at stores throughout Madrid.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds. Many stores offer online shopping with in-store pickup.

activities.name: Madrid's Winter Sports
activities.description: Watch winter sports events or participate in indoor sports activities.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings various sports events and activities to Madrid's venues.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance for specific events. Many venues offer winter sports packages.

ranges.notes: New Year's Day celebrations in Puerta del Sol. Public holiday.
Off-season with fewer tourists and good hotel value. Cold winter climate with daytime temperatures around 10°C.
Three Kings celebration features a spectacular parade through central Madrid and marks the main gift-giving tradition in Spain. January 6 is a public holiday.
Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops and department stores. Museums and cultural venues are less crowded.
Still relatively quiet tourist season with cold winter temperatures. Good time for cultural visits and indoor activities.
Spain's most important contemporary art fair, attracting international galleries and collectors. Held at IFEMA exhibition center.
End of winter season with gradually improving temperatures. Museum visits and indoor cultural activities recommended.
Early spring with gradually warming temperatures. Parks begin to show first signs of spring blooms.
Major design event featuring exhibitions, installations, and events celebrating contemporary design across various venues.
Spring officially begins with warming temperatures and blossoming trees in Retiro Park and other green spaces. Excellent time for outdoor activities and museum visits.
Prime spring conditions with pleasant temperatures ideal for sightseeing and outdoor activities.

ranges.event: Semana Santa (Holy Week - varies by year)
ranges.notes: Madrid's Holy Week processions are solemn and spectacular, featuring elaborate religious floats and traditional music through historic streets. Particularly impressive on Holy Thursday and Good Friday.
Perfect spring weather with warm days and cool evenings. Ideal time to visit before summer crowds arrive. Spring flowers bloom in Retiro Park and other gardens.
Annual literary event held in Retiro Park with hundreds of book stalls, author signings, and literary activities.
Continuing excellent spring conditions with longer days perfect for extended sightseeing and outdoor dining.
Public holiday with events throughout the city. Many locals head to parks for picnics and celebrations.
Madrid's patron saint festival featuring traditional events, concerts, and cultural activities in Pradera de San Isidro park.
Prestigious ATP and WTA tournament featuring world-class players at the Caja Mágica complex.
Excellent time to visit with perfect temperatures. Outdoor dining becomes especially pleasant with all restaurant terraces open. Spring festivals and cultural events throughout the city.
Early summer brings consistent warm weather ideal for outdoor activities and dining. Crowds build gradually but not yet at peak season levels.
Midsummer celebration featuring traditional festivities and cultural events throughout the city.
Summer tourism season begins with longer days and warm evenings perfect for outdoor dining and cultural activities.
Peak summer season begins with hot temperatures. Morning and evening activities recommended to avoid midday heat.
One of Europe's largest LGBTQ+ pride celebrations with parades, concerts, and cultural events centered in Chueca neighborhood.
Summer-long cultural festival featuring open-air concerts, theater performances, and cultural events in various venues across Madrid.
Hot summer weather with many businesses closed for holidays. Many locals leave the city for vacation destinations.
Traditional festival in La Latina neighborhood featuring religious celebrations and cultural events. Public holiday.
Good hotel deals available but some restaurants and shops may be closed. Hot days with warm nights good for evening activities.
Excellent time to visit as summer crowds diminish but weather remains warm. Cultural season begins with new exhibitions and performances.
Spain's premier fashion event featuring runway shows and industry events. Some events open to the public with advance booking.
Perfect temperatures for sightseeing with warm days and pleasant evenings. Full cultural calendar of events as autumn begins.
Excellent autumn weather with warm days perfect for sightseeing. Cultural season in full swing with major exhibitions and performances.
National holiday commemorating Columbus's arrival in the Americas, with military parades and events in central Madrid.
Mild autumn with fewer tourists, excellent time for cultural activities and museum visits. Autumn colors begin to appear in Retiro Park and other green spaces.
Public holiday with traditional cemetery visits and special services. Many businesses closed.
Mild autumn continues with good conditions for city exploration. Lower tourist numbers mean better access to popular attractions.
Major film festival featuring premieres, retrospectives, and special events at various venues throughout the city.
Early winter with cooler temperatures but still pleasant for sightseeing. Preparations for Christmas begin.
Early Christmas preparations with decorations appearing throughout the city.
Public holiday commemorating the Spanish Constitution. Many businesses closed.
'Puente' (bridge) holiday period between Constitution Day and Immaculate Conception.
Public holiday with special religious services. Many businesses closed.
Madrid's spectacular Christmas lights on Gran Vía and other major streets feature synchronized light shows and festive decorations.
Public holiday with limited opening hours. Family celebration day.
Post-Christmas period with continued holiday atmosphere, festive decorations throughout the city, and winter sales beginning.
Celebrations throughout the city, particularly in Puerta del Sol, with the tradition of eating 12 grapes at midnight. Many restaurants offer special New Year's dinners.

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
